artefact: Permit to operate a Part A(1) regulated facility (England and Wales)

artefact.overview: You need a permit to operate a Part A(1) regulated facility in England or Wales
artefact.licence_short_description: Permit to operate a Part A(1) regulated facility in England or Wales.
artefact.licence_overview:
If you operate a Part A(1) regulated facility in England or Wales, you will need to obtain a Part A(1) environmental permit.

A regulated facility is:

- an installation or mobile plant which carries out Part A(1) listed activities described in Schedule 1 of the regulations
- a waste mobile plant
- waste operations, including those carried out at a Part B installation or by Part B mobile plant (unless the waste operation is a Part B activity)
- a mining waste operation
- a radioactive substances activity
- a water discharge activity
- a groundwater activity

Your permit will be issued by the [Environment Agency,](http://www.environment-agency.gov.uk/ "Environment Agency"){:rel="external"} and will be either a standard permit or a bespoke permit, depending on the activity in question.

Not all activities which fall within those categories will require a Part A(1) permit. Some less polluting waste operations may instead require a Part A(2) or Part B permit from the local authority. If you carry out an exempt waste operation, an exempt water discharge activity or an exempt groundwater activity, you may need to register the activity as an exempt operation with either the Environment Agency or your local authority. Please refer to the Environment Agency for details.

##How to apply

[Applications](http://www.environment-agency.gov.uk/business/sectors/117468.aspx "applications"){:rel="external"} must be on the form provided by the Environment Agency. You must provide any information requested in the form or any information requested in addition.

An application fee may be charged.

##Fines and penalties

You must comply with the conditions of your environmental permit or exemption. 

%If you fail to comply with the requirement to hold an environmental permit, on summary conviction you may be fined or be imprisoned or both.%
